C9cGe9kryMC3ZzELOybLFw.text: The idea of Stout Pub & Kitchen is great, but location not so much. The cocktail and beer selection is wonderful! I would for sure go back for some drinks. The food on the other hand...not too sure. My date had the chicken pot pie, it was mildly cold and the flavor was alright. On the plus side the presentation of the chicken pot pie was very nice. The Grilled Chicken Thighs...everything was cold, but I guess it's served that way? That should possibly be stated on the menu.

_abMnsHrAdYlmTtuJ4N9iA.text: First of all I must say the service was good and the restaurant was beautiful! The food on the other hand was just awful! I have never been to a restaurant where everything they served was just darn right bad! The soup came out cold and clumpy, the brussel sprouts were mushy and greasy, the wings were way overcooked (burnt on one side)and had no flavor, the brisket was ok but I couldn't eat it because the bread that it was on was so hard and burnt I couldn't bite into it and the ff were soggy! Even the ranch had no taste. In sorry but I just wouldn't recommend this place to anyone to eat.

X2g13gmrJl0MpnSoF0vC-g.text: I know it's new but the staff need to smile a little. A little would be nice. Make me feel welcome while you take my money.

pYwqDyTS_JNci9PxATq2GA.text: I guess is a craft beer pub, but in my opinion the food is the star.  The food is very good - both the quality of the ingredients and the care, skill and creativity of the preparation.  And it's a "pub" price point for food you would get at a fine dining restaurant.  Shared the pork belly bites as an appetizer.  More than we could eat.  Perfectly cooked.  (I had the leftovers for breakfast  the next day.). Also had the Salmon which was delicious.  And there was something under the salmon - I really cant describe it, but it was DELICIOUS.  My dinner companion had the "chicken thighs" which were really 2 chicken legs. The waiter, I think his name was Kia, was excellent.  Explaining the food and the beer with a great deal of passion.  I will go back next time I am in the area.  Also we were there during happy hour.  Appetizers were $3.00 off during Happy hour.  And the drinks were discounted as well.

GBiKjmpkupmgc8dgXAA08w.text: The West Pittsburgh area is very lacking in non-chain restaurants & we were excited to see a farm to table restaurant opening in a robinson strip mall. We walked in & we're not greeted right away...we actually considered leaving. I'm glad we stuck around. I found the menu to be quite thoughtful and the service was very good (Brandon was our server). The smoked wings with the house hot sauce were delicious. In my opinion, Stout has the best draft menu in the area. Most of the selections were from the Pittsburgh area. We will definitely be back!

PynkkZfYucJqUtM9o-PkgQ.text: The pheasant was excellent as well as the bread pudding. Great selection of local beer and liquor.  Farm to table and great service.

8_PWT-WSZeoKv_1QN1RnIg.text: I have been here enough times to get the entire experience. The food is always exceptional. Lexi has become my favorite bartender. Recognizes me when I come in, great interaction throughout my time here. I would recommend this place to everyone, and I have. But the service is what keeps me coming back. Lexi and Dustin have easily been the two standouts while I've been coming in. I will continue to bring my business here. Keep up the great work guys!

elfqpWM8O7r8r7wJ2HJb5g.text: I only stopped in for a beer and an appetizer. The bartender did not appear to be happy in the least to have a new customer at the bar; perk up like you just opened a restaurant. Good selection of beer.   I was not impressed with the Pork Belly bites.  The menu indicates the belly is confit but it looks like it's been in a deep fryer, thus lacking some flavor.  I imagine it's confit before service and then fried right before serving?  I thought the belly was under seasoned, as I had to salt it.  Even weirder is they drop RAW blueberries, blackberries, and raspberries in the bowl. I understand that fatty pork belly always goes well with some kind of sweet/acidic sauce, but they missed it here.  A chutney or jam with concentrated flavors is more appropriate I would believe.

ONg5mHQxxG53c7jrM2oRyw.text: The lamb shank was amazing the last portion of lamb I've had.   The prices are very reasonable.  Service was terrific.   Highly recommended

10ZDDyQFIr0xjIK4UDI8tQ.text: I'll start off by saying that I was very excited to have stumbled across this place. The place is dope, and like the build out. The menu looks great on paper but that's where 2 stars fall off. I got "smoked" wings that were hardly smoked at all, some of the best fried wings I've ever had but no smoky flavour. My server Harley was great and very attentive to her tables, the two stars are for her. The caesar salad did not live up to the description on the menu. House dressing was missing the salty anchovy flavour. I heard that the place just opened a month ago, hopefully the can pull it all together.

bJ_rJKIHklaYi0O6TNMhZA.text: Great alcohol selection - big props for having Arsenal Cider! We got the smoked garlic parmesan wings for an appetizer & they were delicious. My husband liked his pastrami sandwich and sweet potato fries. I got the brisket sandwich, which was good but the meat was a bit dry. The service was good.  The outdoor bar set up is nice; hopefully we can take advantage of that next time. For GF guests: GF buns are available, but I don't know how good the kitchen is with cross contamination. The fries aren't safe as there's no dedicated fryer.

u6i7u3X77lCGWmkBo-U--w.text: Had the sweet crepes, and they were amazing. Berry compote and a cream filling that wasn't too sweet really balanced each other. Highly recommend for brunch or lunch! Indoor/outdoor bar is a fun twist. Draft beer choices are not extensive, but there is enough variety for almost anyone to find something.

oIdTYih41kOE4NqgQiF7kw.text: I went for brunch and was so pleased. Highly recommend peach mimosas (except they were not cold so I added some ice). I ordered the Dutch pancakes - sweet, savory and fantastic! Service was very good. I will be back soon.

iO7Fh7BNIfMjr5cDAU6fHA.text: Hoo Boy! Lousy experience this evening. Manager SCREAMING, SCREAMING at server, vile, profane. He was hysterical - and right near us. Who can eat? Took the food home, may try to eat it tomorrow.

hLkybXyPJHLIdVxmfEo0iA.text: Similar to another review, we were told the wait was 45 minutes when there were 4 open tables on the front. I understand though, could be short staffed, etc. We waited about 15 minutes and were sat in the back room with 6 tables in a very small area. I couldn't hear one word the person I was with was saying. The acoustics are horrific. On top of that, the booths they kept back there are clearly from the previous restaurant. Really, The Yard? You don't have enough money to buy new booths? DO NOT sit back there if you can avoid it.  We got the smoked wings and pierogis. The pierogis tasted like oil and that's about it. The wings were very good, but similar to most smoked wings at most restaurants. The beer selected wasn't anything that I was expecting. Not a big variety, in my opinion.

_dgpun9_hY2uwd0taHvMTg.text: Came to stout for the first time and we were told our wait would be around 25 minutes so we went outside and sat at the bar. About 50 minutes passed and we went up to the front and asked what was going on and they said they tried texting us but we never received a text . So that was already a bad start. As far as the food it wasn't the greatest. The meat was good but the sandwich was mostly bread. And everything we tried had some sort of apples in it and I'm not really a fan of fruit in my food...the atmosphere was cool but i can't say that I will be back any time soon!

ywn5HPNLx3qpJzSO5_dTAQ.text: Good in theory. Our service was good. The waiter tried hard to answer questions and be present. The beer list is surprisingly small for a place called "Stout" but they did offer a few stout beers. The menu left a lot to be desired as well. I didn't order a sandwich but from what I could see from the people around me, they're mostly bread. I had pasta and chicken, which was possibly the driest thing I've had in a long time. If either the pasta or chicken had any moisture to it at all I could've pushed through. The current vegetable selection reads like a frozen mixed back of Birds Eye veggies at the grocery store. The only bright spot besides the service was the appetizer. I'm hoping they have a rotating menu so that there'll be something worth trying in another couple months. If the menu doesn't change, I won't be back.

JsjLWAD9cppCwJhAWbsTKw.text: Just ok. I liked my sandwich but the other two at our table did not like their giant pierogi. It was a little over priced as well.

9RWE7zLWA6PweKO_B_n5Yg.text: I was sad to hear that Bocktown was closing, but excited at the prospect at a new concept in its place, and Stout did not disappoint. Really love that their menu is hyper local and that their bar also pushes local brewers and distillers. All the food we had was good to very good. My favorite item was probably the pork belly bites, perfectly crispy with a nice sweet sauce. The brisket and pastrami sandwiches were good as was the burger. I do find the prices to be a little bit high for a dying strip mall in Robinson, being owned by The Yard, I feel that they priced their menu more accordingly with downtown or shadyside. Also our service was very average. Our waitress was nice and attentive, but made numerous mistakes. We live in Greentree, so we come to Robinson a fair amount, and Stout will be in our rotation, but I don't think we would make a special trip just to dine here. For the money, I believe there are better offerings elsewhere.

Ifvjtszm6uGvPBtrGmBl4g.text: Really cute atmosphere, although there wasn't air conditioning in the back room where we were sitting and it was super uncomfortable to eat like that. The food was pretty decent. All the sandwiches were really good, but the fish and chips was horrible and so was the chili. The list of beers was excellent, and how they do farm to table locally is awesome. Their cocktails weren't my favorite though, too many random ingredients to be different but ended up just tasting poorly made.

aewSiFOH3RdLIgh9-yHxxA.text: Great savory crepes but honestly the other food has odd ingredients that do not sound appealng to me. Been here twice and I had to get the crepes both times. Hubby had the pastrami and the brisket sandwich. He liked the pastrami but brisket was chewy. Our waitress took our order but we had to ask for silverware and napkins. We never saw her till we were almost done eating. She never offered to refill our drinks till we asked. If you like weird trendy places this is the place for you. The patio is very nice though so I might come for a drink.  again. Good music selection on the patio. The new owners did a nice job remodeling.

IaTZfjJwbeuYZzIN2lIpsA.text: Don't waste time or calories on these pierogies!! They were skimpy on brisket - to say the least for $14 and waaay overpriced for 6 yes 6 small pierogies

AnFEZhPJMwb1sKBMb1VZQg.text: Great waiter, very attentive and pleasant. (It was the muscled dude). Very clean with cool decor. Open and light up. Cool vibes and good feel. ALL the beers on tap are from PA, more need to do this. Had the Brussel Sprouts and Olives, both were great.

l4moii1mlt3MQpsKC0Rh4Q.text: Nice pub with a good beer selection.   Food was just okay though.   Duck nuts were burnt and bland.   Smoked wings were the best item we had.   The Deviled Salad, I added Salmon, was awkward and the Salmon was cold.

FnP_kE04mDdykoERIt55Aw.text: Love TGIF specials.  Place is great. Service was solid, but needs a tad bit of work. Will defiantly be back to try more food items and beer. Patio is sweet

rjGALLzaydEqo3ZLDjvwaw.text: Chicken salad was huge and very filling. Loved the hot wings. Of course the beer selection was fantastic with mostly PA sourced options. Staff was knowledgeable and provided samples. Have been back since for brunch and would highly recommend.

uQlnFd2BpOHQqo6oaSYrDw.text: I was excited to see Stout open and couldn't wait to check it out. I joined a friend for lunch and was overall very pleased. We started with the Brussel Sprout and pork belly appetizers. I really enjoyed them both. The Pork belly was definitely my favorite of the two. For entree's I got the Apple & smoked chicken salad on a baguette with sweet potato fries. This was amazing. The chicken salad was so good and the fries were excellent. I requested a side of ranch and their ranch is a herby homemade which I loved. My friend got the brisket pierogis. She enjoyed them but wished that there was a little more sauerkraut that came as a bed underneath.  The staff at Stout is awesome. Everyone was really nice and attentive. They have weekend brunch and also a special pick 2 lunch menu for weekdays. There is a fine beer selection and also a great page of fresh cocktails. I opted for white wine this time,but I will be enjoying cocktails on my next visit. I will definitely be back to try more things off the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork Belly &amp; Brussel Sprout Appetizers
Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

MsAw38U0Zsn0BumIdMzCzA.text: The music at Noon on a weekday was so loud and it was heavy metal. Not that I don't like heavy metal but not at that time.    The salads and french fries are awesome but their sandwiches are in trouble.  I have had three different sandwiches there and all were very poor. The brisket, pastram and chicken were all very tough and tasteless.    I hope they can get this figured out because it's a nice atmosphere and very friendly staff.

-x6u13j-1NHYpP0-hhEINQ.text: Stout was fantastic! We had ratatouille that was wonderful, fresh and served with house made ricotta. the brisket sandwich was out of this world and served with house made pickles and fries. and also got a pork chop to go because we really wanted to try it but were so full! It was definitely the best out of everything we ate. everything is sourced locally and locally grown which adds the freshest taste to all of their menu items. We had brussels sprouts to share at the beginning of our meal they were roasted perfectly. Can't say enough about the good people who work here. Definitely try stout the next time you're feeling like a great meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ratatouille!

4FtXaQErvtwb7efEhvKo7w.text: Food was good. I had the brisket sandwich and my wife had salmon. Menu has a limited number of food options. There were 30 or so beer options and lots of gin and whiskey options. Overall, good experience.

4gYcSEpsM3wyBJnZxlXLSg.text: Tried a new restaurant for my husband's birthday and was a little disappointed. I ordered the fish and chips and he ordered the pheasant. The fish was moist but the beer batter was soaking in oil. My husband thought the sweet potato fries were the best thing on both plates. The service was great and the place was clean. Probably won't eat here again.

He4MzA4s33ov5aEobV9uzg.text: First off -  I really wanted to like this new restaurant.  With so many chains in Robinson, it was awesome to see something 'local' get launched.  Unfortunately, Stout overall fell incredibly short of expectations.    Service:  Service was good and our server was attentive.  Although we were told several times that we had to 'be done' by 630 as a large reservation was coming in.  Food/Drinks:  We started out with a local whiskey and beer.  The whiskey was at best an ounce, if that.  Very short pour.  The beer was fine and the prices, with happy hour, were fair.  We started with deep fried risotto balls.   Wasn't terrible and was the overall highlight of the meal.  Our main courses however were an absolute disaster.  Upon ordering, we were told the Pierogis were out (this was 4pm on a friday) so we went with their burgers ($14 a piece) and our kids went with a pizza /hot dogs.  We were then told that they didnt have any ketchup for the burgers or fries?  Our burgers had zero flavor and were burnt (asked for medium well). It literally tasted as someone just rolled up some ground meat and grilled it up.  When you are charging $14 for a burger, I'd hope it would have SOME type of seasoning/flavor. My sons pizza was nothing more then a red baron microwave pizza (literally, thats all it was). I wasn't expecting a masterpiece but there was zero effort into making.  Also the price was near 8 bucks for it?!  The hot dogs were clearly microwaved as well.  Fries were good but dry (no ketchup).  That being said we, we won't be back.  When you have restaurants like Burgatory (cheaper and way better burgers) and Industry (larger selection of drinks and better food) there is no reason to return.

PmwkBZyuvOr_4w1FIdD3qw.text: I am staying around the corner at a hotel. I travel quite a bit but now I have one less thing to think about when staying near PIT airport.   If you are looking for great, imaginative food this is the place for you. Foodies should look no further in this area as it is full of typical standard fare.   Really strong beer list and fancy cocktails too. Late night friendly it seems as they have an after hours menu.   Really happy to find this place.   Had the pork bites with fresh berries and some absolutely perfect Brussels sprouts.   Too late for pics, next time.

ppWSI0qjOQgXB6IKuHfHPw.text: I was excited to try this place when I read the menu online and heard about the concept. However, this restaurant definitely fails to meet my expectations, especially for the premium that they charge for their meals. You expect me to pay $32 dollars for a Scallops dish and give me a plastic cup for water and paper napkins? That's bold... That being said, the scallops we very good but the rest of the frills on the plate were very lack luster. The Furniture also resembles the same stuff they use at chipotle. Definitely not worth the money.

f-wIW75O_r8b8DJnYFasmg.text: Love their outdoor bar area! Nice atmosphere and nice selection of IPAs. Food was different. Bar food but some was unique in their own way and style!

hsdzBEMO4gQCp2z8zBcFYw.text: Bartenders here are lovely - all the beer,  liquor and food is LOCAL.  Definitely order the Charcuterie Plate of local meats and cheeses to start (you might have to ask for more bread) - Delicious! Tried the lobster Pierogy - sounds like a good idea but the execution doesn't work (one giant dough in an iron skillet) , so don't try the pierogies.  But everything else we tried was great, plus the friendly staff and fun atmosphere were just right.  Will be back!

Pt2Odicoe0JxxeLTBHhzww.text: Ordered the charcuterie plate, $13 or $15 can't remember exactly. The description said it was an assortment of pates, terrines, cheese and meat--something like that anyway. I wanted some pate or terrine. What I got was really small portions of store-bought salami, about an ounce (literally) of smoked salmon, 4 triangles of packaged pepperjack cheese (how exotic), some slivers of cheddar cheese, and some toasted french bread.  Nothing was homemade--all low quality stuff you can get at any mediocre supermarket.  When I saw the plate, I asked where the pate and terrines were? "Oh, we changed it." I said this is fraud. "I'll let them know."  Well, I don't know who "them" is, but I'm letting the rest of you know that this place doesn't seem to care if its food doesn't even remotely match the menu's description. And clearly the staff did not care about my complaint.  2 other guests had dinner salads, salmon, chicken, that looked OK. They seemed happy FWIW. Me? I'll go somewhere else.

mCnrLE0veVG6s_huZJv5pg.text: Ate here For fist time this week for lunch.  While beer selection is no where near bochtown, it was more that ample for my tastes.  Charcuterie board was good, pastrami sandwich was great...menu was eclectic and reasonably priced.  I will definitely be back to try it again.

hVa_GMcEu1SbWdM46cpDaQ.text: We went here a few days after the place first opened and could tell that it already had its business well in order. I got the fish and chips, which were great, my boyfriend got the chicken pot pie, which was excellent, and our friend got the double-cut pork chop--a huge cut of meat--which was also very very good. We will definitely be back to try more!

i2pSrmXuEFZSILOVpoSI6Q.text: The concept is great and it's owned by the guys who opened The Yard in Pittsburgh. The food on the other hand was so so. I was expecting a ton of flavor when I went but it was all cooked well, just underwhelming. With that said, it's still a great location with great staff. The perogies were a great dish and I definitely recommend those if you're heading here.

NB8thfGIF27Y__sXTwHh7w.text: The food was decent, but not memorable. The atmosphere was a little heavy with hipster pretentiousness. Overall, a step down from Bocktown.

K4sj_wlwMnM-TWqJXy-sRA.text: Decided to try out this restaurant since we were regulars at the prior restaurant in this space. This place did not disappoint. Great decor and atmosphere. All of the food and meat is from local farms. Nice beer selection. We will definitely be back and I would highly recommend this place to others.

fjpdKUS6cxQQmlFqCVAfWA.text: I'm a fan of Gastropubs and after reading reviews and glancing at the menu I chose this place to dine at with a friend. We both got the flank steak salad which was highly suggested by our waitress. Just when I thought that it wasn't possible to mess up a steak salad I was proven wrong. Visually it looked appetizing enough but for $16 the portion was more akin to an appetizer than an actual meal. I never can finish anything that I order at a restaurant including a steak salad. Not only did I finish this but I had to make plans on where to eat afterwards. In retrospect it was a blessing in disguise that the portion was small since it was barely palatable and I left more than a few of their "candy" tasting tomatoes behind.   So where did this dish go wrong? Way too much sugar; why any at all? Why do the tomatoes taste like they were candied? Why did the dressings (blood orange and another that I will assume was balsamic vinaigrette) taste like liquid sugar? I know how to make a vinaigrette and this was not it. The portion size compared to the price was way off, especially given the poor execution of the dish. Finally unseasoned flank steak; did anybody think to even salt and pepper it let alone add anything else? The salsa verde tasted like fresh from the can.The only reason that I did not complain and send this back was because I was on a first date and wanted to focus on that in a positive way. My date also found the dish to be sugary as well. Afterwards we agreed that we should have went elsewhere. My verdict is if you can't master a simple dish then I don't have faith that a more complicated one will be completed either let alone mastered.

DzNKZQ8oyFtIbHi6E6VInA.text: I was so excited to come and left extremely disappointed. The bartenders were absolutely awful. I sat at the bar for at least 5 minutes before I was even acknowledged and they only spoke to me when I confronted them. The man sitting next me waited 10 minutes with an empty glass and said that he had been there multiple times with the same issues. The wings were recommended but they were average at best. We ordered a burger and the fried fish and they were nothing to write home about. If you're going to order fries, go with the sweet potato fries. I'm not a huge fan of industry but i would go there any day before I came back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

QGx2xdpwLVt-RU5yN9rpPg.text: I really liked this place. We had drinks, wings, charcuterie plate and a pastrami sandwich.  The waiter recommended a delicious beer to start with. All PA beer and spirits. Started with the charcuterie plate. Really unique and tasty. Duck prosciutto, yummy olives and a carrot chutney were highlights. Switched to a great PA rye to wash it down. They cure their meats in house and you could tell with the pastrami. Cool preparation for sure.  Table next door got the wings and we couldn't resist. Smoked first and then cooked to perfection. More rye for desert. We will be back soon

PtX5O_pwi57BFVfdyUnI1g.text: Off the beat & path but worth the 1st visit. Really enjoyed the food, beer and atmosphere (particularly out-inside bar seating).  Good beer choices although would have enjoyed a closer local area tap but had 2 different drafts that were great. Farm to table food was awesome. My wife raved about the chicken salad and I greatly enjoyed the briquette sandwich. Highly recommend- not too crowded on the night we visited- Liz was a gracious bartender and server.  You will enjoy.

n9uOHFKogGCbE0I1ZaDa3Q.text: Two visits.  Once at opening and then just recently.  Our latest visit - great wait staff, however all down hill from there.  We ordered the charcuterie board and it seemed a bit bare, we asked nicely and the waiter informed us it was missing 3 things and they were out and it should have never made it out looking like that. What?!?!?  We also ordered the pierogis with crab - got them and no crab.  Questioned again....yep gave the crab to someone else and we had the regular pierogis....what if someone who got them had a shellfish allergy?  This place has so much potential if they could get it together.

ouEJbM7pnJv1gnEmpiP43g.text: We normally wait for a restaurant to be open for at least a month before trying it, but got lucky with Stout (probably because they own The Yard restaurants, so it's not a TOTALLY new concept to them). The food and service were really good. The menu doesn't mention that the fries are steak fries and sadly none of the fries (steak or sweet potato) were crispy - the oil was clearly not warm enough - probably because a LOT of the items on their menu are fried. They also have only a horrible sounding vegetable medley as an alternative to fries, which seems odd. I don't like sweet potato fries or steak fries, so I was out of luck. Maybe they'll come up with a reasonable alternative once they've been open a bit longer.  The menu is annoying (one-sided and tons of pages) and they've already raised prices on a couple things, though we went there less than a week after they opened, but we'll return. The beer list is sideways in the binder, too. Hopefully, they'll fix some of these issues and mention that their fries are really steak fries when they reprint. The menu is just printed on regular paper, so I'm sure they'll work on it.

2MrkJJIgmhNJG7hJONGceA.text: Been coming here for Sunday Funday for a few weeks now. Chill place. Cool looks. Food is amazzzzinnngggg. Bartenders are friendly and skilled (we see Liz and Kim are there most frequently). My only complaint is that the chairs are too tall for my short friend :-)   Recommended!

LXdmUH3wOngrwYWkQsOkUQ.text: Significant improvement to the establishment from Bocktown Beer & Grill.  Quality atmosphere to eat and drink for the summer time once their patio area is open.   Greeted being asked for our reservations which we did not have, while 3 tables lay open in the main dining room.  Wait was estimated to be 45 minutes for 2 however we were seated as soon as our drinks came up at the bar. They escorted us to a back room, which must have been added on during the ownership change as a private party room... maybe 30x20 seating 20 people with 5 tables. This was the loudest dining experience we have had. If seated in this back room we strongly recommend asking to be moved.   We split smoked wings (with ranch, hot & mild sauce on the side) they were phenomenal. Pierogis and a pastrami sandwich with sweet potato fries on the side. Beer selection was strong, no 12oz beer glasses though with 12oz pours.. so the beers looked 3/4 full when ordering.   The food was great and overall an experience we might consider again if it were not for being seated in this back room.

photos.caption: Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pastrami Sandwich-Sweet Potato Fries
Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Stout Pierogis- BRAISED SMOKED BRISKET PIEROGIS WITH HOMEMADE KRAUT, CRISPY PANCETTA, &amp; SPICED APPLE YOGURT

xwzyi_OvgKOvSsIf0WSvGA.text: This is an interesting menu. Scratch made food with house cured and smoked meats.  Stopped in and had a couple of apps and drinks.  The brussel sprouts have a sweet and sharp glaze and some pancetta, a nice combo of flavors.  The pork belly bites were good with a tasty flavor and some fresh blueberries. Most of the pork bites were good but a few were over cooked and hard.  Looking forward to trying other items on the menu.

QJZGWb3SS27hSs5ZLg2szw.text: Came here for the first time, got the stout burger and was not impressed. There was no flavor to it. However, the fries were amazing and my friend ordered the roasted chicken sandwich and said she would definitely come back for it. The pierogis weren't anything to write home about either. Servers are friendly and professional, and able to crack some jokes! It was a good experience all together but some changes could be made.

photos.caption: Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

3mNSiuSR6T2cWfA79g32Zg.text: My wife and I went there last night. We were big fans of the previous location that used to occupy the same space. That being said we enjoyed how open the new owners made the space.   The beer selection was good and included a small number of local brews. The happy hour lasts until 6PM. Drinks and appetizers are best priced during that time. We ordered the fried pork belly and thought that it could have been fried a little more. The skin was not as crisp as it could have been.   The main entrees we got was the chicken thighs ($16) and the brisket sandwich ($14). We will start with the good and that is the brisket sandwich! It was amazing. That is what got the 3 stars here. That was really good and had enough food for one person. The bad is the chicken thighs. Those were dry and can be replicated at home with little effort. The small potatoes that came with them was ice cold. Literally ice cold. The waitress was really apologetic and corrected it right away.   The waitress was really nice and very good. The atmosphere was very loud, first daters should be aware. You can't have a conversation about anything there.  Overall a solid three stars and has room to improve. The staff is good but the space could use a little sound dampening. The back of the house could use a little quality check. Total check was $71.00 including the tip for 4 beers (2 half price), 2 meals, 1 appetizer (half price).

BQvRZWaf3-IRUdVIOCrurw.text: This is my favorite restaurant in North Fayette. It is so nice to have a locally owned and sourced restaurant close and not have to fight traffic into the city. Great service and equally great food.

hoH82r_WZDJG8XREYxmQOw.text: Service is terrible  Sat on patio waiting for service whilst the waitress came out three times and looked at us served another table then left  Third time was a charm stood up with my companions and walked the hell out  Won't be back and won't recommend

qQiI-qLreaFVCFX0zjWdYQ.text: Excellent food! Nice staff. Pulled pork sandwich was fantastic! The place is really cute and has a nice outside bar. Good atmosphere

photos.caption: Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

NBJdRrB1vZ-B_Ek3pOacNw.text: This place is way overpriced, the service is spotty, the portions are small and they try to hard to be weird and different. I'm not picky but most of their food had odd flavors or lack of flavor all together. My boyfriend got the pheasant which was literally the size of a chicken wing with four small round potatoes on the plate. Ridiculous for what you pay. The waitress also forgot everyone's drinks at our table at some point. She would come back with one person's beer and the rest of us would be waiting with empty drinks for the next 15 minutes waiting for her to come back. Nothing here to bring me back.

J0-MCenKbrGZezbZdx8NaQ.text: Great local craft beer selection. The food was tasty. Awesome outdoor seating area.  Everyone who worked there was super friendly.  The bartenders, Lexi and Ben, make great cocktails.  I'm not a cocktail guy but had a swig of the "Toasted" cocktail...great coconut rum drink with cream bourbon.  I could drink this for breakfast, lunch, or dinner...really tasty.   Robinson was in need of some more non chain, unique locations. When bocktown closed, I was super bummed out but this is a great replacement.   Only thing is I wish the menu had a little more variety and options.  I live about 2 miles away and I'd love to come back weekly but the menu isn't extensive enough for me to come back for dinner anytime soon. I will be back for drinks for sure!

yKkA-H7K6zUg-H7N-GixJQ.text: I was actually very disappointed the two times I came here. The food is just not up to the prices. I get it's farm to table, which is what drew me, but the food was not prepared well. The portions were also small for the cost. To clarify, I've had the pork chop (overcooked) and the chicken. My partner had  sandwhich and agreed it was just okay.

f1_eZ8ABvNbZuTQwTQuGOw.text: This is my favorite new spot in the Robinson area! The charcuterie board is great, as are the sandwiches. I've had the corned beef, pastrami, and brisket sandwiches and they really can't be beat. They are each dressed up differently, with mustards or krauts (one even has a bacon jam!) and the bread is SO GOOD. The fries (sweet potato or classic potato) are clearly house-cut and are delicious. They have a great selection of local beers and the happy hour is great (half off all drinks and $3 off apps, not including the charcuterie board). I'm looking forward to trying their selection of mains, which aren't available until after 4 pm. This place is halfway between work and home, so I can see myself getting into some trouble here. Great new place, go check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Corned beef sandwich
Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Charcuterie board
Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brisket with sweet potato fries

jhHJ4H2Cb8Wxn4Ea7NeQHA.text: I love that Robinson is getting better options! Everyone at Stout is super kind and accommodating, ESPECIALLY with a small child, and they've always made us feel comfortable. My husband and I got the corned beef sandwich and it was really good and not greasy like it can be some places.  Our kid was pretty annoying (at least to us) but the staff was really friendly and understanding. The pierogis are phenomenal and they have a great selection on draft.

xZ5cXurVRHP6_ZOwrECl9A.text: First I will say the restaurant is beautiful and the bar area is very nice. There is a large local beer selection. Our waitress was also excellent. I really wanted to like this place since the yard is one of my favorite places. The food is a good concept but my friends food was cold and there was not that much for the price. I probably wouldn't return.

oxvsQk_O0gCns-X6SId3GA.text: Went for Brunch - Nothing special. I personally think they're overpriced for what you get but the food was good. The place was empty when we went. Service was friendly and fast.

N_QFzd6vaUVpfVrzfVfCjA.text: First time here. Loud atmosphere. Good food. I had the stuff burger and it was really good and filling. Opted for the sweet potato fries and they were a disappointment. Soggy and burnt. Now, I do understand that caramelizing will bring out the sweetness but they were beyond carmelized. They had a definite burnt flavor.  The wife ordered the chicken salad on briosch. The chicken was very tasty but the bread was too hard. This would've been better served on something a tad softer. She opted for the soup which was  walleye chowder. The portion was dinner size and she only ate half so as not to spoil her appetite. She said it was "amazing!". It must've been because I can always count on having here take homes for dinner the next day, when I looked for it, it was fine. She took it to work for lunch.i also tried the pork belly bites which was first time trying pork belly and I found it just ok. That portion was pretty damn huge too for an app. Apps are definitely for sharing. Great beer selection too. I would recommend.

1mwNsEMHgwG_WOMSbTSUdA.text: Great drink selection.  The food flavor profiles are great but the food was definitely over cooked.  Pirogies as an app were great.  Chicken and waffles were tasty but overdone.  My chicken sandwich was also very chewy but could definitely be awesome if not cooked so long.  We will be back, hopefully this issue can be remedied and let this place be  a permanent fixture in Robinson.

NxI3_6TEoK10zoCICrKYQA.text: Worst meal we've had in awhile. We ordered 2 apps.. a brisket pierogi and the Brussels sprouts. The Brussels sprouts were delicious but soaking in a liquid sauce.. I like mine a little more crispy. The Brisket pierogi was an awful greasy skillet of mush.    Then we ordered another round of drinks and she only brought mine. Later asked if he'd like another and at that point he just said no.   Next, our food came. My salmon was completely raw so I asked for it to be cooked more. It took 20 min. The salmon quinoa salad I ordered was a salmon fillet on top of a handful arugula, quinoa, and blueberries for $16.   In the meantime I figured I'd try his brisket sandwich because it looked good. It was cold and dry. I had to ask twice for extra sauce.   I'm always understanding especially being in the service industry but the restaurant was not overly busy.  We won't be returning and I would never recommend this place.  Very unimpressed.

1XjOw8QbhZizw94dinNTOQ.text: Updating review based on second visit to Stout. For a weeknight, the restaurant was steady busy - and still had some weeknight specials on the menu. Our bartender/waiter (IAN) was great. Not only did he recommend great beers/cocktails - he was VERY attentive and helpful when it came down to ordering/making sure we were extremely happy with our food.  Again, ordered pretty much everything on the menu (appetizers, main entree, and even dessert)   I was very, very happy with the food and service this time around. The drinks were also great.  Only downfalls, the menu is a bit over priced - and like I have said in my past review, location is a little silly. Tucked way back in an abandoned plaza near Robinson town center.  Would recommend this place to anyone local - or traveling to/from Pgh. from the airport. Can't beat the fresh food & drinks!

photos.caption: Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beet salad cheese on side (little overpriced)
Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. BC!
Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

BC1br6jcmORmGvbhETTOmw.text: This place was actually pretty good. It is a farm to table type of restaurant. They have happy hour which is $3 off some of their starters and half off some of their drinks. Their prices are a little much especially in the area they are located but overall good food and I absolutely loved the variety of different brews they had for their flights.   The Mojito Lime Cider was one of my favorites has you can taste the mint and lime in it. Definitely try their coffee brews such as Java Head and States they both have different flavors but were really good as well. My coworkers loved the Just Peachy beer, which I thought was ok. There is definitely a beer for everyone even the ones who do not drink beer.   Their wings were good in flavor, could be a little more crispy. The fries were really good, both the sweet potato and regular. I had the smoked brisket sandwich which was amazing with the apple slices and the bacon jam it gives it a unique flavor and the brisket was not dry at all. Plenty of space to hang out at and they have a outside area as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

oKOGaOafcOWGHofJFPfdJw.text: Had a great experience here!  Our waiter was absolutely fantastic and had a sense of humor that I appreciated.  Drink menu is vast.  The Caesar salad is amazing. A must have!  The brisket pierogi was great. We requested it first for an appetizer even though it's not on the appetizer menu. It was a little doughy but flavorful.  And here it is..the best pork chop I have ever had. It was at least 4 inches thick. Only 28 bucks. Most places in the city would charge more. Although I really liked my meal, my husbands steak was a little fatty for his taste. Regardless, we will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bens purple drink
Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brisket pierogi
Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Caesar salad

B2G4CD4Rpus8Lx5_zWWmHQ.text: Hey everyone!     Let's address the elephant in the room.  The location of Stout pub sucks. It is in Robinson, but it's tucked in and hard to find, plus the sign is tiny.  Had I not read the review on Yelp, I would of never tried the place.  Now on the to good stuff. Before you even enter the front door, the place smells amazing. It has a camp fire, bourbon, wood grill smell, that draws me in like a moth to a bug light. Once in the front door, the smell only gets better.  We were greeted and seated quickly. The waiter fetched us some water and explained the menu.  He informed us they have been only open about a month. They, as much as possible, use Pennsylvania sourced food and liquor.  Plus they source their food locally and are a farm to table restaurant. They also smoke their own meats and home make a lot of other items. The decor is steam punk/hipster, it works well and seems well designed.   The food:  We ordered the brussel sprouts for an appetizer.  I have a serious brussel sprout addiction. These were very good. They were  just the right amount of soft and crispy, with a soy-ish sauce and home made pancetta.  I highly recommend this app.   Lunch:  I ordered the pastrami sandwich and my date ordered the chicken salad sandwich. My sandwich was very good. It was paired with stone ground mustard, some greens, and those little pickled radishes.  I also ordered a side of sweet potato fries. Both meals were very good.    So all in all this place is worth trying. The new decor is very popular right now, and I always feel a little hipster when I eat somewhere like this. The homemade and locally sourced foods and liquors make me feel good about supporting PA. It's nice to see something like this in the south/west hills.  If you like Cure in Lawrenceville, you'll definitely like this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pastrami
Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brussel sprouts
Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken salad

jOnSxV08LyciJCMB0LbvuQ.text: I thought this place was okay. A little hard to find. The restaurant space is nice and spacious. There was a strange smell when we walked in. It was also really cold in the restaurant, you'll need to keep your jacket on. Staff was friendly and attentive. They have a pretty good draft list and lots of cocktails as well. Happy hour is from 4-6. They were out of a few things tonight. I had the Stout Burger which I thought was pretty average. It was a weirdly shaped burger, the patty was like a ball. Made it kind of awkward to eat. But it was cooked well. The fries weren't very warm. Overall, if you're looking for one of the few non-chain options in the chaotic and overcrowded Robinson, this place is worth a try, maybe I just hit them on a bad night.

photos.caption: Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Stout Burger

7suAkvG6W2c5tuJG1NKpzA.text: I didn't realize this place opened literally days before we were there! WOW! It was great.  Best parts: We were greeted immediately by John, the bartender. He asked our names, was super friendly, made great suggestions and also makes a mean Loddy Toddy. I don't know who was there when people got the stink eye, but it wasn't this group. They were fun and engaging.  Food. The bomb. We had pierogies and wings to start (Owners: get blue cheese. Just do it. I'm bringing my own next time if not. :) ) Then split a brisket sandwich that neither of us could put down. Drippy and delish. We also split fish and chips. Also great, but I was so stuffed I could barely take two bites.  They pride themselves on being strictly local. Food from local farms, beer and spirits from local breweries/distilleries. I love Pittsburgh, and I love local.  Can't wait till the patio opens and we can come BACK! John said he would save us a spot at the patio bar. Okay, He didn't, but I hopes he reads this and does so anyway. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

BkihILejEY21BBeCqfqsAA.text: Was deciding between this place and another so we decided to go here mostly because I wanted the charcuterie plate with the pate. When we actually got our board I was very disappointed with the size of it for $15. And there was no pate that I was looking forward to it. The three cheeses were all white and firm so that was disappointing to not have different contrasts and textures in something like this. Also seemed very light on the meats for the price. I did like the berry compote and the pickled onions. Those were nice touches.   We split a house salad. Very good. Loved the raspberry dressing  We also split a brisket sandwich. I asked for extra bacon jam on the side because who doesn't love bacon jam? This was good but I wouldn't call it jam. It seemed more like some bacon pieces in syrup. I was glad to have it though because to me the brisket sandwich seemed dry although my husband said it seemed more flavorless. They didn't have barbecue sauce which we thought was strange if they had brisket but the bacon syrup did help to moisten it and give more flavor so we did end up enjoying that and liked how thinly sliced it was.   Service was great! The bartenders were nice and knowledgeable. I will admit we did not mention any of our issues with them because we were in a bit of a hurry and they were busy.   I would like the owner to take Pate off the description for the cheese board though. I noticed there was a post 7 months back with the exact same complaint I just had. I looked at the online menu and again on the menu at the location as it's on both. I would also make it bigger or cheaper as to not feel ripped off.   Decent dining experience. Not sure if I will return or not

photos.caption: Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Charcuterie plate
Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Charcuterie plate
Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brisket sandwich

Kn_a2PQcIFukacmbHuCc2w.text: Was just as surprised to see Stout open as I was to see its predecessor closed.  All new menu and beer options but a familiar gastropub lean.    The pros: Service was great (though it was not particularly busy) Food was great Farm to Table Local/sustainable  The cons: Price (more than your usual lunchtime dine and dash, especially in the Robinson area) Location (maybe this is a plus if you want a "find" but nobody is going to see this restaurant who isn't looking for this restaurant.)  I'm eating healthy these days, so I didn't sample Stout's nominal strengths:  house cured and local meat, and local beer and spirits.  At this point everyone in Pittsburgh should know that you can populate a menu in any decent restaurant with food that is locally grown/sourced.    So too, more than ever, brewpubs and ciderhouses.  I didn't do a deep dive into Pittsburgh microbreweries but did enough to know there are 50+ in an hour and a half radius of the city.  You could drink a new beer every day and not have the same beer twice for a year.   But working, and trying to be "healthy"...I steered clear of cured meats and microbrews, and there's probably another star to be had for a drunker, less healthy reviewer.    I had a quinoa, salmon and arugula salad.  It was a nice balance of savory salmon on peppery greens with a dash of acid bright vinaigrette and sweet refreshing blackberries.  The quinoa was marinated, and, as someone who hasn't really eaten a lot of quinoa...I found it mixed nicely with the overall salad, and I felt healthier for having eaten it.  It filled me up nicely too.  I didn't notice upon entry, but after I'd left there was a faint scent of cured meats that lingered on my clothes.  It wasn't off-putting, in fact, I've been smelling myself off and on for the rest of today.

photos.caption: Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sushi-grade salmon on quinoa and arugula with blackberries
Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Local drafts
Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

rldSZk6m16c_YaQG5spFnA.text: Drinks:  the beer list was awesome! A lot of great local beers from small breweries which I loved! We got a flight and a few glasses.   Food: We started with the charcuterie board which was alright- the cheese selection was good, but the meat was all the same.  I ordered the pirogies which were rock hard, my husband had the lamb shank which was terrible and not worth $28. The food display was terrible as well.   The drinks were great, but the food was terrible and way over priced.

Qh6mpWyCl2D2efsRgAuTYw.text: We loved this place! We moved from Chicago, and we miss the the food scene there. Several months ago, we tried the Yard in Shadyside for brunch and liked it a lot. Stout is from the same owner. In fact, they will be opening another location of the Yard next door to Stout.  There is a great selection of local brews and whiskeys. We did not try the cocktails (it was Sunday night), but they sounded great.  We started with the charcuterie. The meats were smoked in house. The duck prosciutto was all kinds of fatty goodness. The cheeses were local. The pickles and pickled radishes, which are made on site, rounded out the plate. I had the stout stew, which was delicious.  My spouse had the deviled Caesar salad for her entree. She was very pleased. I had the chicken pot pie, mostly because I assumed that it would be a smaller portion. I was wrong. It was huge. It was made with chicken that they smoke in-house. It came in a rich gravy. The portions at this place, in general, are big.   The food is well executed. The drinks are great. We are so glad this place is close.

photos.caption: Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The charcuterie plate was almost gone before I could snap a picture. Great with a beer, a glass of wine, or a cocktail.
Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The chicken pot pie was huge!
Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The stout stew was rich, fatty, and delicious!

kUH-8wAQnKgtgQ0AFXDPcw.text: We had a really great experience! We got the twisted Alfredo and the salmon. The Alfredo was the best of the two. The cauliflower mash that came with the salmon was really amazing. Whatever cheese they put in that is really good :)

photos.caption: Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

loCXSCxTcU508N9vW1HUFA.text: I wasn't sure what to expect, because other reviews seemed to rate highly on food but poorly on service/wait, but my co-workers and I were having difficulty finding restaurants near our hotel that weren't part of a huge, national chain.  We visited on a Wednesday night and were immediately seated; the restaurant was about half full while we were there. Our server very quickly stopped to take beverage orders, which also arrived quickly.  It seems like we were not a victim of whatever issues may have affected other reviewers!  One co-worker and I both ordered the pan-seared salmon (one medium rare and one medium well) and my other co-worker ordered the braised lamb shank.  I also ordered a house salad to start. The house salad was good, with the one big positive being the pickled vegetables: you get various veggies on your salad everywhere, but the tart addition of the pickling was a nice touch. My co-worker who order the lamb thoroughly enjoyed her meal: it was a good size and she said it was well prepared.  The two of us who ordered the salmon also enjoyed our meals, but both of us were a little annoyed with the large pearl onions.  When the waiter told us that the seasonal vegetables on the menu included pearl onions, I expected them to be of a size that I could easily eat them in one bite: that was not the case.  As you can see in the picture of my plate, we instead ended up with a very large, very round, very unstable vegetable that was incredibly difficult to stab with your fork and then cut without sending it flying across the restaurant.  If the onions are always that large, I would suggest cutting them in half in the kitchen so your guests are not assaulting each other with flying onions (or just leaving them on the plate like my co-worker did).  Overall, an enjoyable meal with great tastes that I would be glad to repeat in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pan-seared salmon
Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. House salad

qjLSvH10X-N8EQj9PEeGXw.text: Absolutely wonderful restaurant. The menu has some amazing options. The hot wings fell right off the bone. Crispy on the outside. Best I've had in a while. The corned beef sandwich was absolutely perfect. The is my second time here and I will be back frequently.

photos.caption: Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

1H8oyyX2am2lVCcuwS_dPw.text: Bad service - it's funny because I've always had bad service at The Yard, then I find out it's the same ownership or management. But yes - the service here is always bad. If you sit at the bar, there is always an overwhelming amount of fruit flies (mainly around the taps).  The good - food is a 4/5 stars. It's good. I'll give credit here. The beer/alcohol is a 4.5/5. It's mainly all local stuff which is awesome!  I hope this place improves its service.

WBP4H58BkRo3cLJhL0_lOw.text: This is my new favorite Robinson restaurant. It is located where bocktown used to be.  The menu is unique, and everything we ordered was super tasty.  We saw the fried chicken and waffles come out and that looked amazing.  I also love the new layout and how breezy it is when the bar area is open.  It was so nice to sit inside but have all the fresh air blow on us.

photos.caption: Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The chicken sandwich was super big.
Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Burger was huge.
Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. These were so yummy.

2CvIg2ItLQpzG-4YvV1buw.text: They really renovated this place quite nicely. We loved the opened indoor/outdoor bar. We ordered the smoked wings as an app and they definitely were one of the best I have had. (Plus the  handmade ranch was fantastic) For dinner I had the pastrami, which I would not order again.  It was warm and chewy. The sweet potato fries were great though.  My husband liked his burger however I was not wild about it. We will return for happy hour and apps, we just may skip the entrees next time !

photos.caption: Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

o7LmKkPS_6jC_T36DPzHvQ.text: I love Stout!  I've gone to happy hours, lunch, and dinner here and have never had a bad experience.  The lunch specials are the best value but it can take awhile (longer than a 1 hour work lunch).  I'm also a huge fan of the brussel sprouts, smoked brisket, and sweet potato fries!

ZUuZM3YVLzM36j3VMdS_4g.text: Loved the idea of farm to table and local/fresh ingredients....but our meals left a little to be desired.  I ordered the pan-seared salmon with cauliflower puree risotto and roasted veggies.  Hubby ordered the steel head trout with quinoa and roasted veggies.  The fish was just basic (not a whole lot of flavor).The veggies on both of our dishes tasted like they were cooked in water and nothing else.  Being that they are locally sourced, there were a few menu items that they were out of.  The staff was helpful and did a great job.  I'm sure we will give this place another shot, but I don't think I will go for the main dishes.

4Il5N6PC2O9467mYI0o6-Q.text: Great menu, Awesome food, great atmosphere,  Wonderful staff.  Dustin the waiter provided great service.  Will definitely return!   Brussels sprouts are a must get!

4XIfaoMySPnhjM6EotRlug.text: Wanted to try the charcuterie board but unfortunately it was sold out so we tried the pork belly bites.  I had never tried this before and actually found them pretty good.  My husband tried the chicken pot pie.  While he said it was ok, he likes the traditional pot pie.  This has a flaky rectangular crust just on the top and it just didn't mesh well.  While it was his own fault for not reading the menu correctly, this version has sweet potatoes in it and he thought they were carrots.  I had the pheasant which basically tasted like chicken.  And for the tiny portion I received it certainly wasn't worth $22; but the duck con fit croquettes that came with it was delicious. Bread pudding good, but not warmed all the way through; comes with ice cream from somewhere in Ohio.  This ice cream is the best!! It is so creamy.

photos.caption: Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. bread pudding
Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. pheasant
Photo of Stout Pub & Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. chicken pot pie
